doc.previous: The metal was used by pre-Columbian Americans near modern-day Esmeraldas, Ecuador to produce artifacts of a white gold-platinum alloy. The first European reference to platinum appears in 1557 in the writings of the Italian humanist Julius Caesar Scaliger as a description of an unknown noble metal found between DariÃ©n and Mexico, "which no fire nor any Spanish artifice has yet been able to liquefy".[38]
